metadata.title: CVE-2019-1010302 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
jhead 3.03 is affected by: Incorrect Access Control. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: iptc.c Line 122 show_IPTC(). The attack vector is: the victim must open a specially crafted JPEG file. It was discovered that jhead did not properly handle certain crafted input. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious JPEG file, a remote attacker could cause jhead to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-1010302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jhead - 1:3.03-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jhead package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.03-2').
